Spatial Weights and Applications

Loading of Packages

Code 
pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, tmap, tidyverse, knitr)

#inclass uses sfdep, handson uses spdep

Getting the Data Into R Environment

Importing shapefile into r environment

Code 
# st_read from sf package 

# task: make it into sf df
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                 layer = "Hunan")

Import csv file into r environment

Code 
#tibble df
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
#head(hunan,5) colnames(hunan2012)

Performing relational join

Code 
# left join-> missing a unique identifier but it automatically matches county

hunan_GDPC <- left_join(hunan,hunan2012)%>%
  select(1:4, 7, 15)

Visualisation

Code 
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape (hunan_GDPC) + 
  tm_fill("GDPPC",
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "GDPPC") +
tm_layout ( main.title = "Distribution of GDP per capita by distribution",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45,
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
tm_borders (alpha = 0.5) +
tm_compass (type="8star", size = 2) +
tm_scale_bar() + 
tm_grid(alpha =0.2)

# tmap auto changes from decimal to kilometres using great circle formula

Identify area neighbours

Code 
# using queen's method (default value of function)

cn_queen <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         .before=1) # put newly created field at the first col

#View(cn_queen)
Note

What about the Rook’s method?

Code 
cn_rook <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         queen= FALSE,
         .before=1)
Code 
# sfdep removes the earlier step and conbines 2 function/ it is redundant

wm_q <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb),
         .before=1)

# Spatial Weights and Applications

## Loading of Packages

```{r}
pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, tmap, tidyverse, knitr)

#inclass uses sfdep, handson uses spdep
```

## Getting the Data Into R Environment

### Importing shapefile into r environment

```{r}
# st_read from sf package 

# task: make it into sf df
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                 layer = "Hunan") 

```

### Import csv file into r environment

```{r}
#tibble df
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
#head(hunan,5) colnames(hunan2012)

```

### Performing relational join

```{r}
# left join-> missing a unique identifier but it automatically matches county

hunan_GDPC <- left_join(hunan,hunan2012)%>%
  select(1:4, 7, 15)
```

## Visualisation

```{r}
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape (hunan_GDPC) + 
  tm_fill("GDPPC",
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "GDPPC") +
tm_layout ( main.title = "Distribution of GDP per capita by distribution",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45,
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
tm_borders (alpha = 0.5) +
tm_compass (type="8star", size = 2) +
tm_scale_bar() + 
tm_grid(alpha =0.2)

# tmap auto changes from decimal to kilometres using great circle formula

```

## Identify area neighbours

```{r}
# using queen's method (default value of function)

cn_queen <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         .before=1) # put newly created field at the first col

#View(cn_queen)
```

::: callout-note
What about the Rook's method?
:::

```{r}
cn_rook <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         queen= FALSE,
         .before=1)
```

```{r}
# sfdep removes the earlier step and conbines 2 function/ it is redundant

wm_q <- hunan_GDPC %>%
  mutate(nb= st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb),
         .before=1)
```
